intro: Hoheria glabrata, commonly known as the silver kohekohe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its silver-green, narrow leaves and showy, bottlebrush-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. It is often found in coastal forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Hoheria glabrata is also important in traditional Māori culture and has ecological significance in its native habitat.
